name: Python
description: Core language for data analysis, scripting, and machine learning pipelines

name: SQL
description: Querying, manipulating, and managing relational databases

name: R
description: Statistical computing, data analysis, and graphical visualization

name: Scala
description: High-performance functional programming, often used with Apache Spark

name: Java
description: Backend systems and maintaining legacy big data infrastructure

name: TensorFlow
description: End-to-end open source platform for machine learning and deep neural networks

name: PyTorch
description: Deep learning framework focused on flexibility and ease of use

name: Scikit-learn
description: Simple and efficient tools for predictive data analysis and classical ML algorithms

name: Pandas
description: Fast, flexible, and expressive data structures for data manipulation in Python

name: NumPy
description: Fundamental package for scientific computing and array processing in Python

name: Apache Spark
description: Unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing and streaming

name: Hadoop
description: Framework that allows for the distributed processing of large data sets across clusters

name: Kafka
description: Distributed event streaming platform for high-performance data pipelines

name: Airflow
description: Platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor data workflows

name: Docker
description: Containerization platform to build, ship, and run distributed applications

name: Kubernetes
description: Automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications

name: AWS Redshift
description: Cloud data warehouse service for large scale data analysis

name: Snowflake
description: Cloud-native data warehouse allowing separation of storage and compute

name: BigQuery
description: Serverless, highly scalable, and cost-effective multi-cloud data warehouse

name: PostgreSQL
description: Advanced open source relational database with strong stability and extensibility

name: MongoDB
description: NoSQL document database for high volume data storage

name: Tableau
description: Visual analytics platform for business intelligence and data visualization

name: Power BI
description: Microsoft's interactive data visualization and business intelligence tool

name: Git
description: Version control system for tracking changes in source code

name: dbt
description: Command line tool that enables data analysts and engineers to transform data in their warehouse

name: Databricks
description: Unified data analytics platform based on Apache Spark

name: FastAPI
description: Modern web framework for building APIs with Python

name: Flask
description: Micro web framework for Python, often used for deploying ML models

name: Terraform
description: Infrastructure as code software tool for building, changing, and versioning infrastructure

name: Linux/Bash
description: Command-line scripting and operating system management
